title: Renée Zellweger strolls through Sydney Airport after the Australian premiere of Judy
text:
She dazzled the Australian premiere of Judy at The Capitol Theatre in Melbourne on Tuesday.

But on Wednesday, Renée Zellweger opted for a low-key look at Sydney International Airport.

The Academy Award-winner, 50, appeared to go make-up free and showed off her slender physique in a casual ensemble.

All smiles! Renée Zellweger puts on an animated display as she shows off her slender figure in a casual ensemble at Sydney Airport

She dressed for her flight in a pair of khaki green trousers, a comfortable white long sleeved top with her black sports bra peeking through.

The blonde beauty opted for a pair of lace up boots and a set of black sunglasses.

Proving she's not too famous to carry her own belongings, the Hollywood A-lister strolled through the terminal pulling a small cabin suitcase next to her, while toting a black bag in one hand.

Chic: She dressed for her flight in a pair of khaki green trousers, a comfortable white long sleeved top with her black sports bra peeking through

Travelling in style: Proving she's not too famous to carry her own belongings, the Hollywood A-lister strolled through the terminal pulling a small cabin suitcase next to her, while toting a black bag in one hand

She also slung a black suede tote bag across her lithe physique.

A day earlier, Renée stopped by Melbourne for the premiere of her latest film Judy, which is a biopic on the life of screen and stage legend Judy Garland.

She oozed glamour fitted black dress that showed off her slim physique with a one-shoulder design.

Post-premiere glow: Renée opted for a soft make-up palette, with a dusty rose matte lipstick and touches of blush and highlighter

Renée opted for a soft make-up palette, with a dusty rose matte lipstick and touches of blush and highlighter.

Her look was accessorised with a pair of pointed black high heels and a statement ring in a dark tone.

Renée's performance in the biopic is earning her critical acclaim and award buzz back in Tinseltown.

Ready carpet glam: Renée oozed glamour fitted black dress that showed off her slim physique with a one-shoulder design at Melbourne's The Capitol theatre

Despite whispers of nominations, she has played it down telling E!Online: 'happy that people seem to be touched by the film. That's what we had hoped.'

Judy's family, including her daughter Liza Minnelli, have publicly distanced themselves from the film and do not intend to see it.

Renée told Lorraine last Wednesday: 'It's an emotional, a private and complicated thing, but my hope is that it will be recognised as this expression of affection and a proclamation of her importance.'

She added: 'I do know that representatives of the family and estate have seen the film and that makes me smile.'
description: She dazzled the Australian premiere of Judy at The Capitol Theatre in Melbourne on Tuesday.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
